page.title: 02MARCHAM: LANDSCAPE
page.content: Marcham is in the District of the Vale of White Horse. Its nearest town is Abingdon. It is part of the valley of the River Thames, and most of the land is used for agriculture. Our picture (A) shows a typical view of the country to the south of the village. This looks over the ground around the River Ock which joins the Thames at Abingdon. One of the main problems in Marcham is the road which runs through the narrowest part of the village. This is on a double bend and there have been a lot of accidents there. There is a picture of the bend(B). Because of the importance of this, we did a transport survey to find out about the cars people have in Marcham, and what journeys they did. This is at page 17.
